itemDescription: British businessman and CEO of Tesco

wikipedia_page.main: Sir David John Lewis (born 1965) is an English businessman. He is the former CEO of Tesco, serving from 2014 to 2020. Prior to joining Tesco, he was president of global personal care at Unilever.

response: On 1 September 2014, Dave Lewis, previously of Unilever, took over as CEO. In January 2015, Lewis announced plans to close the company's head office in Cheshunt and 43 loss-making shops in the near future, and the cancellation of 49 new large supermarket developments. The shop closures were expected to make 2,000 staff redundant, while a further £250 million of cost-cutting measures were planned.

In January 2019, Tesco announced another cost-cutting initiative that would close the food counters in 90 stores, affecting around 9,000 workers. In October 2019, Tesco announced that CEO Dave Lewis would step down in 2020, and would be succeeded by Ken Murphy.
* Dave Lewis – CEO of Tesco PLC
David or Dave Lewis may refer to:
*Dave Lewis (American musician) (1938–1998), African-American Seattle rock musician
*Dave Lewis (Northern Irish musician) (born 1951), Northern Irish singer-songwriter
*Dave Lewis (politician) (born 1942), American state legislator in Montana
*Dave Lewis (footballer), footballer and leading goalscorer for Cheltenham Town F.C.
*Dave Lewis (ice hockey) (born 1953), Canadian hockey player and coach
In October 2019, it was announced that Murphy would become CEO of Tesco. He succeeded Dave Lewis on 1 October 2020.

link_mentions.page: Timeline of the COVID-19 pandemic in the United Kingdom (July–December 2021)
response: *Former Tesco chairman Sir Dave Lewis is appointed as the UK government's adviser for supply chain management following the crises with fuel supply and the supply of other essentials.
